channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024020063
item.description:
Report E-2024020063

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 29, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of isopropanol was damaged in transit due to a load strap failure and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, any cleanup debris, and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2024020005
item.description:
Report X-2024020005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: LA CROSSE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 4 drums were on a pallet and 4 pails were placed on-top of the drums and the entire pallet was shrink wrapped. The pails on top were not wrapped tightly enough together which allowed one of the pails to tip in transit. The pail leaked out onto the pallet below and to the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2024010714

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: MADISON

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the box in the hazmat cage . DescribePack: once inspected, found that the plastic container holding a liquid has a good-sized tear in the plastic under the handle. some has leaked out, which the box has absorbed. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: all was put into the hazmat cage in a plastic lined black tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020015
item.description:
Report E-2024020015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: VIROQUA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 11 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024010518
item.description:
Report E-2024010518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a result of a forklift puncture, a 55-steel drum containing Methanol was punctured. This resulted in 15-gallons of Methanol released onto a concrete, dock floor affecting a 10'x10' area. A Contractor was called to clean-up the spill. The damaged drum was over-packed into a 95DF along with absorbent pads and booms. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.
